text: Machair or machar is a GÃ idhlig (Scottish Gaelic) word used to describe a fertile low-lying grassy plain found on some of the north-west coastlines of Ireland and Scotland, in particular the Outer Hebrides. There are machairs in the Isle of Skye, The Isle of Barra, the Isle of Harris and all throughout the west coast and islands. == References == * Angus, S. (1997). The Outer Hebrides: the Shaping of the Islands". The White Horse Press. Category:Grasslands Category:Geography of Ireland Category:Geography of Scotland
title: Machair
